html: Their families come to the U.S. out of desperation. We need to address this humanitarian crisis head on. That means reuniting families immediately and passing a bipartisan, comprehensive solution to fix our broken immigration system. We need action now. #FamiliesBelongTogether

html: These children are not criminals. They're fleeing unimaginable violence in their home countries and looking for safety.
text: These children are not criminals. They're fleeing unimaginable violence in their home countries and looking for safety.

html: At CBP, we saw immigrant families held in what looked very much like jail cells. Unaccompanied children are held in a bare, open space for days. This is where they eat, sleep, and wait to hear where they will be sent next. They are anxious and hopeless.
text: At CBP, we saw immigrant families held in what looked very much like jail cells. Unaccompanied children are held in a bare, open space for days. This is where they eat, sleep, and wait to hear where they will be sent next. They are anxious and hopeless.

html: In El Paso, I also toured a Customs and Border Protection processing center and holding facility where families seeking asylum and unaccompanied migrant children are held.
text: In El Paso, I also toured a Customs and Border Protection processing center and holding facility where families seeking asylum and unaccompanied migrant children are held.

html: The tent city looks more like a military installation in a foreign country than a place where children are cared for in the U.S.
text: The tent city looks more like a military installation in a foreign country than a place where children are cared for in the U.S.

html: These children are being held in dusty tents. They are in an unfamiliar place and far from their families and friends. Their showers and bathrooms are outside in trailers. They’re given damp rags to protect their faces from the heat and dust.
text: These children are being held in dusty tents. They are in an unfamiliar place and far from their families and friends. Their showers and bathrooms are outside in trailers. They’re given damp rags to protect their faces from the heat and dust.

html: Seeing these minors alone without any idea what will happen next was disturbing. No child should have to live in these conditions.
text: Seeing these minors alone without any idea what will happen next was disturbing. No child should have to live in these conditions.

html: This week, I went to Texas and toured the Tornillo detention facility outside of El Paso. This is the site of the tent city holding unaccompanied immigrant children and children who have been separated from their parents.
text: This week, I went to Texas and toured the Tornillo detention facility outside of El Paso. This is the site of the tent city holding unaccompanied immigrant children and children who have been separated from their parents.

html: In 2016, Members of Congress spent an average of more than $28,000 of taxpayer money on franked mail -- with some Members spending upwards of $100,000 on self-promotional mailings. The #NoFreeCampaigns for Congress Act will change that.https://www.reviewjournal.com/news/politics-and-government/jacky-rosen-introduces-bill-to-limit-lawmakers-free-mail-use/ …

html: I introduced the #NoFreeCampaigns for Congress Act, a bill to rein in and reform the franked mail program. It's time Congress stops wasting hard-earned taxpayer dollars on glossy campaign-style mailers.pic.twitter.com/YGDLig0tGj
text: I introduced the #NoFreeCampaigns for Congress Act, a bill to rein in and reform the franked mail program. It's time Congress stops wasting hard-earned taxpayer dollars on glossy campaign-style mailers.pic.twitter.com/YGDLig0tGj
